FAIL_TO_PASS: when default write() then version on stdout
when long option flags conflicts then throws
when missing option-argument then shows help
should call action when there are no implicit conflicting options set
when program has value/no flag specified with value then specified value
when custom write() then version on custom output
should allow default value with a conflicting option
when short flag obscured then help term is --help
should report correct error for positive option when negated is configured
when conflict on program calling external subcommand then throw conflict
when program has yes/no not specified then error
when specify just custom short flag then display version
when program has mandatory-yes/mandatory-no flag specified with flag then true
should report correct error for negated option when positive is configured
when both help flags masked then not displayed in helpInformation
when specify --help then exit
when help flags obscured then implicit help hidden
when option argument not in choices then throw CommanderError
when help requested then context.error is false
when helpOption has just custom short flag then custom short flag invokes help
